Open Reply is a London-based eCommerce and Digital Experience company that uses design and technology to create better, more profitable customer journeys for its Clients’ brands. Open Reply has deep expertise in creating smartphone and tablet experiences, as well as desktops. Open Reply is part of the Reply SFA (Italy) Group of companies with Monsoon, Sainsbury's, The Body Shop, Delhaize, Goodyear Dunlop and the BBC amongst its clients.

• Designed and implemented a web application using HTML, CSS, PHP and Javascript named ‘Spring-A-Story’, which was used for multiple research studies on empowering children to be more independent in reading using technology
  • Worked with academic members in Human-Computer Interaction and Psychology in order to deliver project outcomes
  • Responsible for writing up research papers and presenting research findings
  • Conducted both quantitative and qualitative data analysis on data gathered from focus groups, one-on-one interviews, surveys, remote and local user testing
  • Integrated user research into product designs and design practices
  • Took part in IDC2020 Workshop: Creating Opportunities for Children’s Critical Reflections on AI, Robotics and Other Intelligent Technologies”

Lancaster University is a highly ranked UK university with a global reputation for excellence in research and teaching. Lancaster is consistently ranked among the top 15 in all three major UK university league table, and continues to build a growing reputation both nationally and internationally.

001 Skincare London is a luxury British brand, its hybrid skincare lines merge cutting-edge bio-technology with natural and organic ingredients using innovative Asian formulation techniques in a performance-driven formula designed to "return skin to a state of natural equilibrium", counterbalancing the excesses to which we expose ourselves daily.

Specialised in Human-Computer-Interactions and Web Applications. My thesis was focused on designing and developing a wordless picture book application for young children. The course provided the fundamentals of software and hardware computing solutions for real-world problems. This includes understanding operating systems and database systems (SQL, NoSQL) creating programs using C#, C++, and Java. As well as creating mobile and web applications by using programming languages such as HTML, XML, CSS and JavaScript. Apart from this also studying artificial intelligence (Lisp, Prolog) and human-computer interactions. Therefore, developing mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills for the computing industry.

As a developer, UX Designer and Digital Marketer I have extensive experience creating digital products in both the marketing and development spaces. Through working for both a startup and a large company, I have seen multiple sides of the industry firsthand. I bring expertise in UX design, user research, development and communication skills to make quick decisions to keep projects on track. I'd love to leverage my experience to create innovative digital solutions.
